We welcome you to work in our South Calgary office, and we also provide great technology for working remotely.LocationCalgary, AlbertaEmployment TypeFull-TimeMinimum ExperienceSenior Manager/SupervisorJob Type: Full-time

It’s all about the experience created, from the customer experience to the agent and teaminteractions in creating the best systems, process and services we can for our clients within a positive proactive way. A key role to any real estate team is the Team Administrator. This role has developed with the industry into so much more than just coordinating calls andappointments. A Team Administrator role is much more encompassing and core to the team and covers among others the following:i) Social Media: Working to coordinate, develop, tweak and schedule with consistency Social MediaStrategies for a real estate team to ensure we have not only a solid grow forward calendar of events but to ensure the pre-planning is there to coordinate all advance works to success. Social media is so ingrained into the marketing of real estate that the importance of working with the team to develop listing, sales process and coordinate key support players likevideographers, photographers, applications that ensure our social media posts are engaging and at the level that sets the bar higher.Our Team Administrator will embrace social media marketing and coordinate to ensure we have the best going forward for our clients and team all within process and systems thatensure consistency in delivery and efficiency in operation. If you do not know how toschedule and efficiently posts social media through multiple platforms, coordinate Facebook / Instagram and LinkedIn ads for maximum exposure to target areas and engagement and to utilize our web sites, software apps and design service providers to ensure we have the best social media marketing going forward and process driven responses and engagements than that’s ok for now. What is key to us is that you embrace this task and the development of a social media strategy that will make our team and clients properties stand out. We are not going 1/2 way on anything we utilize and the goal here will be to ensure we maximize all of our applications and service providers.Our Admin will ensure injuries, likes and commentators to our social media channels receive a direct interaction in return and will work to coordinate where practical through teammembers…(i.e. listing agent responses to inquiries, ensure follow-up is received). In addition will apply metrics to our social media and lead generation therefrom that providemeasurement and a directive growth plan to reach key strategic targets and objectives.ii) CRM: The customer relationship is centric to everything we do. We utilize a leading CRM thatprovides the ability to create solid customer interactions and flow through processes toensure our clients, team and lead opportunities receive the best customer interactionspossible. The successful applicant will not only work to create follow-up campaigns for lead engagement responses but work to develop within customer relationship experiencemanagement for our clients and to develop together with the Lead Real Estate Teamcustomer relationship process for the team and for our own interactions and updates to our team.Key to this process will be the ability to create system and process that ensures consistency of delivery every time all the time. Equally important to any CRM system is measurement that can be gained for metrics of responses from lead source. Tracking what works best, continually improving and providing the best relationship management we can for ourcustomers, strategic partners, support team and agents is core to the role.iii) Online: Our online content is key and we use a leading web site provider to ensure our web sites are easy to administer, update and manage from SEO through to DDF resources that can create engaging lead generation our web sites deliver. Our Administrator will managecontent, engagement, and ensure we have the best going forward for the Team. Theinternet is not static so ensuring were have planning and process to our online presence is key. A cross check attention to detail is key to any campaign or send out, test first andensure accuracy and the desired look and then run forward. Online is more than just web sites and while social media is key power tool for marketing it doesn’t stop there, there are services and providers that will ensure SEO its running and the ability to run SEM through Google Adwords through to ensuring our mapping business info is proper and updated as well as our reviews. Again here, process, procedure attention to detail and pre-scheduling / planning are key ingredients possessed by our Admin to ensure we have the best working for the team and our clients.iv) Video: We work with videographers to capture video but as well will be doing some of our own video marketing and utilizing some user-friendly software to ensure we have the quality and delivery necessary to ensure results. We see video as key to our marketing programgrowing forward. It is an innovative and unique way that can be very productive. The key is like any other part of our team structure plan, process and deliver consistent video content going forward that reflects our brand identity.Our Admin will be a key part to maintaining a process driven approach to our videomarketing and look for ways to utilize video into our CRM System to provide more engaging follow-up as well as to increase participation and reach within our video-based initiatives.v) Accounting and Deal Processing: The office we work within has exceptional admin who handle are deal processing side and provide regular income / expense and HST reporting to us. The core role of our admin within this is to ensure we have our core accounting and invoicing at hand, maintain and review budget forecasts ongoing and to provide a finger on the pulse resource to accessing the deal processing side and reporting we need to maintain ongoing oversight of our operations income, expenses and deal related to do’s and summary reporting.The primary focus of our admin from the deal side is the customer relationship side of the transaction from the reach out for Google Review (we can review approaches through third parties to systemize this) through to the delivery of reminders and organizational to ensure the key follow-up Sellers need throughout the sale process are delivered. Right down to the CRM integrations of key dates (house anniversary reminders), closing gifts and yearlygreetings at Christmas. While a level of accounting and admin is a key part of the role for our Administrative Coordinator it is not the core role, as that remains the customerrelationship management.Summary reporting and regular Leadership Review ongoing is a core part of theadministrative side of this role. An understanding of how to arrange basic accounting and recording tables inside of excel is key.vi) Meetings: An unplanned non-agenda driven meeting can, on the odd occasion be quite productive,however we are all very busy and a lead role to our admin is to ensure meetings occurregularly, agendas are pre-advanced reviewed and organized, informative strategic partners are from time to time brought in. Our Admin role is to ensure regular bi-weekly meetings are organized, structured and maintained regularly.We are also looking at better ways to coordinate meetings virtually so that we meet the needs of a growing team where work out of the office is factored into our structure. We have Zoom and we equally want to ensure connection to admin can be easy through zoom or other direct means of our team to connect to admin during regular hours for one-to-one video chat asrequired. Emails and text can never replace the value of a conversation, and this ties back into our goal to build, grow and nurture solid working relationships with our team.Lastly, no meeting is complete without a summary follow-up send of the key items covered within. So attention to the core details, the proactive sharing of input from all of the team and respect for all points of view to create a meeting where proactive engagement is welcomed is key. We do not expect our admin to start and run office meetings, but we do want anadministrator that can work towards that end and create a pro-active team centric culture for our office meetings. We are here to help; the key is getting the end goal to what a YRG Meeting is and how to create meetings that are planned and deliver solid value to the team.vii) Oversight: As part of the process of buying and selling real estate there are a lot of moving pieces. These include MLS Data Sheets, working with the graphical files, reviewing, and assembling core details, surveys, geo-reports, taxes and more. Core to the Admin process is theattention to detail that goes into the review and cross check of everything that crosses your desk. Review of numeric inputs, text and grammar, cross check and calendaring key dates and applying and developing consistent systems to ensure consistency to the process is key.We are looking for an Admin that has an eye for detail and will apply process to ensure that nothing slips through and will not be shy about following up with the team for thedeliverables needed and ensuring that the customer service experience is delivered through no dropped balls or outputs that do not meet our expectations.viii) Pro-Active To The Process: Our administrator is a key part of our team, your input is highly valued and together we can do great things for the team. We will look to our admin for valued input into the growth and development of the team and the culture we are building within the team and last but by no means least the customer experience we create.Closing Summary: The above reflects an overview of the role we are looking to have filled. We are very busy agents, and our time is limited occasionally so it goes without saying that an independentapproach and ability to get the goal and run with it is key. We equally respect that there is a learning curve, to some of the items mentioned here. We don’t except all skill sets to be at hand what is most important is the approach to growth and learning and to truly take success from growing this team forward through all applications and systems we apply.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $40,000.00-$60,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Bonus payBenefits:Company eventsOn-site parkingSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftEducation:Secondary School (preferred)Experience:Marketing: 1 year (preferred)Administrative: 1 year (preferred)

Role: Bilingual Educational Tour Consultant (English, French)
EF Division: Educational Tours
Location: New Brunswick, Fully Remote

Your Opportunity:
As an Educational Tour Consultant, you’ll oversee a geographic territory in Canada and run it like it’s your own business. Your mission? To inspire educators to show their students the world, serving as their partner to create travel programs at their schools. In this sales role, you’ll work at its intersection with marketing, customer retention, operations, and product innovation, to name a few. To achieve success, you’ll create your territory’s roadmap to sustainable growth, resolve business challenges, and work with a diverse set of colleagues from across the world that will result in a beautiful customer experience. Our sales strategy emphasizes long-term relationships and consultative conversations. We will onboard you, train you, and support your continued career development with our comprehensive Entrepreneurial Sales Development Program.
What You'll Do:
Manage and grow a geographic territory of existing and prospective clients
Work with middle and high school teachers to launch travel programs
Run your territory like a business—identifying, developing and executing opportunities to drive growth
Acquire new customers, and grow existing key accounts, to help more students and educators discover the world
Forecast and deliver key account metrics (monthly and quarterly sales projections and goals)
Refine your sales techniques and support customers through email, phone, online presentations, and in-person meetings
Support your customers every step of the way—from inspiring them to lead a tour, to helping them recruit student travelers, preparing them for departure, ensuring they enjoy their time on tour and return home safely.
Collaborate with our internal operations teams to ensure the successful delivery of your client’s travel experiences
Sell a product that truly changes students’ lives by being fearless, focused and having fun! And you travel too!
How You’ll Grow and Develop:
As an Educational Tour Consultant, you’ll join our multi-year Entrepreneurial Sales Development Program that is designed to transform you into a fearless business owner and entrepreneur. As our name implies, at Education First your education comes first. We focus on cultivating your sales technique, entrepreneurial spirit, and professional skillsets. We want you to not just have a job at EF—we want you to have a career. We’ve helped our people grow into senior sales, marketing, operations, finance, technology or anywhere else your skills and passions can help our business grow.
Who You Are:
People from all different professional and educational backgrounds have thrived in this role. Here’s what they have in common—sound like you?
You’re eager to start, or expand, your career in sales with a role that offers real responsibility and accountability
You're fully fluent in English and French and ready to serve customers in either language.
You’re fiercely competitive, in a nice, team player sort-of-way
You’re a great persuasive communicator and natural networkers who loves talking to people
You don’t subscribe to the phrase, “that’s not my job”
You nail the details while moving quickly, never losing sight of the big picture
You know that you can sell and you’re not afraid to prove it
You want to be part of a team that motivates and inspires you
Going above and beyond is the only way you do things
Why You’ll Love Working Here:
Work in our light-filled office where you’ll enjoy comprehensive professional development, frequent social programming, office-wide sports leagues, and employee-run social groups (including our “EFinity” groups: Black@EF, LGBTQ+@EF, Indigenous@EF, API@EF, and Parents@EF). And did we mention the free coffee, beer, and snacks?! You can also expect:
Paid international travel at least once a year (more as you grow with us)
Robust professional growth opportunities including monthly trainings, workshops, and inspiring talks with global leaders and experts
Three weeks paid vacation your first year (four weeks starting in year two) and nine paid holidays
20% company match on your RRSP (25% after 5-years)
Excellent health, dental, and vision coverage, along with life and disability insurance
Wellness benefits including $500 yearly fitness reimbursement
EF program discounts including travel, language schools, childcare, and more
Discounts at local venues and businesses
Eligibility for our Workplace Flexibility Program: our pilot hybrid work model with up to two days of remote work per week.
Competitive compensation including bonus earning potential.
About Your Future Employer:
At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs—focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics—turn dreams into international opportunities.

When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about—we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, identity, parental status, experience and everything else that makes you unique.
Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has school and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://ef.com

The Company
At Canopy Growth, our mission is clear: improve lives, end cannabis prohibition, and strengthen communities. We believe that cannabis can be a force for good. We’re building a consumer-centric organization that is focused on sharing the transformational potential of cannabis with the world. We will achieve this through an innovative and disruptive portfolio of cannabis and hemp-derived products.
With millions of square feet of licensed production capacity and operations spanning four continents, Canopy Growth is the world's leading cannabis and hemp company. We recognize that employees are at the core of our success, and we take pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity.
Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue our incredible momentum of growth. If you are interested in building global challenger brands, scaling a business, and working in a values-driven environment, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Business Operations Program Manager, the Retail Operations Lead will maintain and develop the retail sales performance reporting infrastructure for the Company.
This position requires collaboration with all members of the team. Candidates must possess the ability to work in a fast paced environment, are comfortable working with large amounts of data, have excellent analytical and communication skills, thrive in a high-performance culture, be willing to take on broader projects, think proactively and possess good business sense.

Responsibilities

As a member of the Retail Operations team, you will drive the creation, implementation and roll-out of new programs, processes and systems within our retail stores (corporate and franchise stores).
Function as a liaison between the Support Office and stores by influencing and supporting future strategies and tactics for cross-functional partners and retail
Responsible for process optimization at the store and support office level
Responsible for program and process evolution: setting key deliverables and measurables, cross-functional alignment, writing communication, creating content, implementation and follow up and gathering feedback
Escalate and drive the solution of in the moment/urgent operational issues that impact stores
Create standard operating procedures for all areas of the Store Architecture
Manage the varied day-to-day support needs of our retail stores, ensuring that all in-store operational processes are operating as expected
Support and own Retail Operations led projects, as well as cross-functional support and participate on other departments projects
Support in rolling out and leading store pilots
Develop programs and processes that address operational gaps in retail stores, as well as identifying opportunities and risks to projects and roll-outs.
Work closely with retail communications and the retail operations calendar to ensure that programs and projects are delivered and communicated to the right teams at the right time
Building relationships and communication channels between various stakeholder groups, including: Franchise Partners, Compliance, Marketing and Community, Product and Inventory Management, Finance, Training, and Store Maintenance
Continuously training and educating the stores on optimizing and managing key programs, as well as partnering with retail training to create processes and programs that are easily trainable and digestible
Ensure that customer experience is consistent across all stores through the development of retail standards and guidelines
Respond to queries (phone, email, in-person) from store managers and other store staff on operational related items
Visit stores on regular basis
Other duties as assigned

Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field from an accredited university
2-5 years of retail operations experience
A detail oriented mind and incredible time management skills
Experience in building, launching and maintaining large-scale projects
Advanced MS Office skills with a particular focus in Excel and PowerPoint
Ability to multitask and prioritize to meet deadlines
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills - must be able to communicate effectively to operations management and produce effective reports
Accountable self-starter – must be able to recognize needs, formulate a response, build consensus and initiate action
Quick learner and adaptable to an ever-changing environment
Excellent team player and ability to work independently
Solid decision-making skills with the ability to understand and assess business needs and risk

Other Details
This is a full-time position based out of Toronto, ON.

We appreciate the interest from all candidates, and promise to review all applications, but we will only be contacting those who best fit the requirements. If you don’t hear from us, don’t fret; every resume we get is kept in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.
Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
One last note: the chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.
Thank you so much for your interest in Canopy Growth.

Are you ready to join Canada's most-shopped general merchandise retailer, with over 500 stores from coast to coast?

Canadian Tire offers customers a unique mix of products and services through three specialty categories in which the organization is the market leader - automotive parts, accessories and service; sports and leisure products; and home products.

Canadian Tire offers competitive compensation packages including; benefits, potential for profit sharing, extensive training, and career opportunities from within and across the country at the Canadian Tire Retail stores.
Summary:
The Fill Crew Associate is a member of the Logistics Fill Team and has a key role in ensuring that products are transported from the warehouse to the sales floor in an efficient manner. This position includes a lot of lifting and carrying.
Main Responsibilities and Tasks:
Customer Service

Maintaining housekeeping disciplines in the warehouse and salesfloor in order to facilitate location of products by all staff.
Responding to and handling customer and staff inquiries, requests, and concerns in a timely manner.
Locates products in the warehouse.
Guides customer to the location of requested items.

Operations

Operates computer and scanning devices for tracking inventory and enters all relevant coding in Canadian Tire systems.
Keeps up to date with in-store promotions, in-store deals and product locations.
Stocks shelves and merchandise display areas neatly with correct merchandise.
Secures heavy display items.
Maintains inventory accuracy and identifies/reports low stock levels (e.g., hole check and bin cap analysis).
Maintains merchandise on the retail floor and ensures that retail basics are executed efficiently (labeling, product facing, cleaning aisles and display areas etc.).
Ensures that product and overstock is placed in the appropriate locations.
Removes stock belonging to a different location and replaces damaged or expired items when necessary.
Reports stolen and damaged goods to Management.
Assists in pricing and verifying price labels as needed.
Assists in organizing warehouse as needed.
Readily disposes of shipping boxes, trash, etc.
Completes necessary paperwork on a daily basis.
Complies with company, store, department, and warehouse policies.
Abides by all health and safety programs and regulations. Reports any observed or potential hazards immediately.
Uses professional language and maintains a professional appearance (e.g., uniform, hygiene, grooming and name tag) when interacting with others.
Completes other tasks, as required.

Requirements

Ability to follow direction and coaching.
Basic math and computer skills.
Aptitude with computer technology / locating systems.
Aptitude for online learning.
Ability to work in other areas of the store is an asset.
Must be Available Mornings,Afternoons and Nights.

Required Skills and Abilities:

Strong belief in the Canadian Tire Values of honesty, integrity, and respect.
Excellent organizational and technology skills.
Ability to work in a team environment that provides assistance and support to co-workers to achieve common goals.
Results-oriented individual.
Effective written and oral communication skills.
Ability to complete detail oriented retail tasks according to instructions and to demonstrate responsibility for outcomes.
Ability to resolve retail and/or customer issues.
Ability to adapt and cope with challenging and changing situations.
Positive attitude, punctuality, and solid work ethic.

More about the position:
Potential Career Opportunities

Next levels: Promotions Associate, Supervisor, Warehouse Manager and Promotions Manager.
Other retail, customer service and management opportunities in a large network of more than 500 Canadian Tire stores across the country.
Career opportunities across the larger Canadian Tire family (Canadian Tire Petroleum, PartSource, Mark’s, FGL Sports Ltd, Canadian Tire Corporation Limited, and Canadian Tire Financial Services).

Physical Demands and Working Conditions


In compliance with the store’s Health and Safety Policies and Procedures:

Standing/walking for 8 hours.
Using lift equipment.
Lifting and/or carrying of merchandise items, as required, on a regular, frequent and unassisted basis. Merchandise items may vary in weight from “light” to “heavy”.
Lifting and turning repeatedly throughout the shift.
Lifting and twisting above the shoulder, from the floor to shoulder, and floor to waist.
Ability to go up and down a ladder and stairs while carrying merchandise.
Walking and carrying things at the same time and pushing/pulling, as required.

Quinte Health Care (QHC), located in south/central Ontario, is an integrated system of hospitals working with our partners to provide exceptional care. With fantastic restaurants, a thriving arts and culture scene, and more than 40 wineries, the Quinte region is an excellent place to live. The array of parks, picturesque beaches, golf courses, and waterfront trails, provide plenty of opportunity for outdoor adventure. This dynamic, growing community offers affordable housing in both urban and rural settings and is an easy commute to larger centres such as Toronto, Kingston, Ottawa and Montreal. At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experiences, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating the online businesses of Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. Based in downtown Toronto, we are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and collaborative team working towards transforming the way Canadians shop by creating leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, loyalty, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started! To achieve these goals, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to collaborate and solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
We are hiring a SeniorManager, Loyalty Planning & Analysis who will support the overall PC Optimum portfolio team with strategic planning and analysis, market and customer insights, and program performance measurement. This individual will be responsible for shaping the loyalty strategic plans, establishing and monitoring performance against core objectives, and driving recommendations on new strategies and improvement opportunities. The Senior Manager will lead the Planning & Analysis function for PC Optimum, collaborating with a cross-functional loyalty team including Loyalty Portfolio Management, Loblaw Digital, Marketing, Data Insights & Analytics, Loblaw Technology, and Operations.
What you'll do
Facilitate the development of PC Optimum annual strategic plans and play a critical role in shaping the long-term strategic direction and goals, by staying close to market dynamics and customer trends
Conduct customer and financial analysis, generate market insights and develop business cases to support strategic decision-making for the Loyalty portfolio
Closely monitor overall Loyalty program performance, including analysis into any variances to budget, forecast and strategic plans, to inform opportunities for innovation, change or improvement
Support day-to-day decision making of cross-functional loyalty stakeholder teams with relevant and clearly articulated analysis and insights
Lead the development of materials for regular communications and meetings with senior stakeholders across the enterprise, including business results and strategic updates
Provide leadership and coaching to a Business Analyst to deliver on the team’s objectives and enable customer-centric decision-making
Collaborate closely with a support team within a central data and insights organization to extract required data and develop required measurement tools
Does this sound like you?
University Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or other relevant field
5+ years related work experience in a strategic and analytical role. Experience ideally in Retail, Loyalty, CPG industry, Consumer Finance, or Consulting
Excellent strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, strong analytical capabilities and positive can-do attitude
High proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Powerpoint)
Ability to synthesize large amounts of data into analysis and insights
Strong ability to build presentations and present complex ideas in a clear, articulate way
A creative and curious thinker who is comfortable working with ambiguity, ability to multi-task, prioritize workload and work in a fast-paced environment
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with cross functional teams; able to effectively communicate issues, actively engage and influence, and work collaboratively as a team member
Showcase leadership to coach a high performing team
Effective organizational skills with a strong attention to detail while managing multiple projects or workstreams
A Passion for advocating for the customer and helping teams deliver exceptional customer experiences
How you’ll succeed
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!
Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
Covid 19 Vaccination Policy
COVID-19 is a serious condition and has had a devastating impact on Canadians and others across the globe. As a leading Health and Wellness provider for millions of Canadians, our goal is to help all Canadians "Live Life Well". In support of this goal, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees as we continue our phased approach of office reopening. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 Rapid Antigen Screening in order to access the workplace.

This exciting role is at the center of Home Solutions campaign planning and execution – where you will build out TV base management programs, customer targeting, relevant positioning, key messages & tactics to engage TELUS customers and rally our internal team members to deliver bottom line results. Join the Home Solutions Marketing Go To Market Base Management team to drive our Optik TV customer base management strategy and execution. In this role, you will develop campaigns and tactics that ensure we meet our revenue targets via upsell, packaging migrations and churn reduction by engaging our customers with content that matters to them.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You’ll create best in class go-to-market (GTM) strategies that drive excitement around the breadth of Optik TV content, our value proposition and new TV content available on our platform. Driving organization priority on the entertainment value of content and its importance to our business and customer will be a focus in this role. You'll strive to drive continual improvement, transparency and collaboration across stakeholder groups and channels. Expect to play a key role in launching new and innovative campaigns in partnership with our key stakeholders in the TV Content and the Products and Services team.

Support the strategic development, financial outcomes, planning and tactical execution of integrated go to market activity, marketing strategy, campaigns & partnerships
Serve as a customer program strategist and execution leader for the products & services team, content team, marcomm team and channel partners on all things specific to Optik TV base management strategy, fostering highly collaborative working relationships to drive results
Focus on initiatives that deliver on a personalized customer experience, but drive key business outcomes that support customer acquisition, revenue growth, customer satisfaction and content affinity
Provide strategic overviews, updates and recommendations to the leadership team to assist with key decision making and future planning activities
Uphold Optik TV as the best entertainment product on the market and act as a ambassador for all things TV

all things TV

 A natural leader, known for your ability to bring groups together and communicate effectively

Action oriented, with a focus on driving continual result and growth

A business degree in Marketing or Communications

Niagara Falls-based Canadian Niagara Hotels Group of Companies is one of Canada’s largest and most successful diversified entertainment businesses, with more than 2500 talented professionals spread across its various Hotels, Spas, Conference Centres, Restaurants, Craft Brewery and Distillery, Indoor Waterpark, City Touring, Entertainment and Specialty Retail businesses - with more to come! We are home to world-class brands including Marriott, Sheraton, IHG, Morton’s, Milestones, Hard Rock Café, Rainforest Café, Hershey and Starbucks - to name a few. Regardless of what business or role you start with, career development opportunities and rewards are endless for people delivering exceptional guest satisfaction and attaining business results.

Located on the brink of one of the world’s greatest natural wonders, the Marriott on the Falls Hotel and Conference Centre and Marriott Fallsview Hotel and Spa are minutes away from area attractions, world-class wineries, golf and casinos.

With 404 guest rooms and suites, Marriott on the Falls Hotel and Conference Centre offers exceptional guest room accommodations, sumptuous dining options at its on-site Milestones Fallsview Restaurant, over 40,000 square feet in meeting space, and much more. With 432 Fallsview guest rooms, the Marriott Fallsview Hotel and Spa offers fine dining at the Morton’s Grille Restaurant, the luxurious full-service Serenity Spa, Magnificent Tours, and over 7,550 square feet of venue meeting space. Whether our guests are traveling on business or taking a much-needed vacation, our mission is to always exceed the expectations of our guests.

Summary of Responsibilities:
As a Senior Events and Conference Services Manager, you will be responsible for the successful event planning and the execution of Events and Conference Services that take place within the Hotels. The Senior Events and Conference Services Manager will interact frequently with Customers and Guests to learn about their needs and develop relationships from which to earn repeat and expanded business. Reporting to the Director of Events and Conference Services, responsibilities include but not limited to:

Key Responsibilities:

Projects a professional, friendly, engaging and knowledgeable personality during all interactions with all Clients and Associates.
Acts as a liaison between Hotels and groups, ensuring timely guest communication and professional guidance during planning stages, meeting space is appropriately set up, and handling any special client requests seamlessly to ensure the highest quality of guest service and complete guest satisfaction.
Works closely through pre-event & post-event brand standard processes with the Event Operations team to ensure successful clients expectation is achieved every time.
Accountable for the customer experience from initial enquiry to the post event phase.
Works with Event Operations team to ensure guest needs are met or exceeded from beginning to end of service experience from the greeting from Event Services team, food and beverage delivery, fulfillment of special requests to invitation to return.
Responsible for contacting clients, preparing all event documentation, and ensure events progress seamlessly by following established procedures, collaborating with other employees, and ensuring accuracy.
Coordinates with Sales, property departments and customer to ensure consistent, high-level service throughout the pre-event, event and post-event phases of property events. This position primarily handles complex events. Ensures a seamless turnover from sales to service back to sales. Recognizes opportunities to maximize revenue by up-selling and offering enhancements to create outstanding events. Supports and acts on behalf of the Director of Events and Conference Services in his/her absence. Serves as the event planner’s primary contact (following turnover) on property and is responsible for his/her experience.
Coordinates planning for conferences, banquets and special events, including consulting with sales and food and beverage to establish goals and services required.
Ensures billing accuracy and conducts bill reviews with the clients prior to processing the final bill.
Participates in client site inspections and assists with the sales process as necessary.
Facilitates various meetings as necessary (Banquet Event Order meeting, pre-cons etc.).
Solve problems and/or suggest alternatives to previous arrangements.
Adheres to all Marriott and company standards, policies, and procedures.
Performs other duties as assigned to meet business needs.

Requirements

Must have 3+ years of Event Planning experience in a hotel of comparable quality, preferably as a Conference Services Manager.
Must be creative and passionate about events and guest service.
Degree/Diploma from an accredited University/College in Hotel and Restaurant Management, Hospitality, Business Administration, or related major considered an asset.
Proficiency with computers and software programs, including Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel.
Flexibility with schedules, including mornings, evenings, weekends and holidays.
Ability to provide excellent customer service throughout the entire customer experience.
Command of the English language both written and verbal.
Pleasant and outgoing personality with demonstrated organizational skills.
Must be poised under pressure and maintain a highly diplomatic attitude with challenging guests and under stressful circumstances.
Willingness to work in a team environment and assist others within the department when needed.
A detail orientated individual.
Must be able to work with minimal direct supervision.

Job Description

Engineering Group Manager - SDV Infotainment Software Applications

Description

Location: Markham, Ontario, Canada

Dream Big

At General Motors Canada, you will find go-getters, people that dream big and focus and commit to uncover the next ground-breaking idea. From designing and engineering state-of-the-art plants, developing new electric vehicles and self-driving technologies, and crafting the next generation vehicle applications - we are determined to change the future of mobility.

The Infotainment Applications group at the Canadian Technical Centre is at the heart of delivering GM's in-vehicle user interface and software applications. With years of experience maximizing the power and flexibility of Android, we are continually redefining the customer experiences of General Motors connected vehicles for all our brands - Cadillac, Chevy, GMC, Buick.

Join a hardworking and engaged software development team who have adapted to new remote working conditions, while delivering exciting new software applications for electric vehicles like the Hummer EV and Cadillac Lyriq. Our ambitious and inclusive culture means you will be joining a strong diverse team that promotes fresh innovative thinking and give you the opportunity to impact the course of our global vision - Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions, Zero Congestion. Our people are the driving force behind making this a reality. Innovation lives here, so should you!

The Opportunity

General Motors Canada is hiring Engineering Group Managers to grow and manage teams for Infotainment Software. The role will work hand in hand with GM Canada teams and GM global product group on product development and launching.

As an Engineering Group Manager, you will lead, inspire and build highly engaged team to develop, deliver and maintain the next generation infotainment platform, applications, products and tools on time, on budget with quality. You will supervise and motivate team to fulfill department and company goals in a dynamic, rapidly changing environment. And you will also collaborate and facilitate continuous improvement of engineering process and operation efficiency for high quality products with ultimate customer satisfaction.

Key Responsibilities

Provide hands-on technical leadership on a variety of features and capabilities on the Infotainment Software Applications and Services
Work with product owners and user experience teams on building high quality features that make users love our product by leveraging your knowledge in Application Development using Android's Material Design, Vehicle Data properties and messagingprotocols such as CAN
Champion writing code that is reliable, maintainable and reusable because you have a thorough understanding of OOD principals
Mentor developers in the area of software engineering and Android best practices by conducing code reviews, participating in technical review discussions, tutorials and hosting prototype sessions
Innovate by staying current with the latest Android platform capabilities, making relevant recommendations that improves our product and codebase
Be mindful of best practices when it comes to securing data-in-transit and data-at-rest because your code protects our customer's data
Collaborate and direct third party software designs and development work to align with overall project objectives and timing
Hire, coach, develop and retain competent and engaged staff to achieve personal, professional and corporate objectives
Manage and refine software development process to support multiple concurrent releases across different locations
Foster and maintain a positive and collaborative work environment to motivate and empower staff while driving for efficiency and innovative solutions
Identify and remove obstacles and ensure team has proper tools, training and resources to accomplish assigned tasks within defined process, while adhering to safety and budgets
Identify long term goals for the team (technical and people) and work with leadership to fulfil the needs
Be a valuable member of an energetic team that encourage sharing, caring and collaboration!

Qualifications

Required:

Minimum of 8 years of experience in an automotive, or consumer electronics, embedded product development organization
5+ years of experience developing or leading complex, real time, embedded software in an object-oriented environment (preferably native Android Apps & Services or Automotive), including people leadership responsibilities
Thorough understanding of OOP concepts, Android application architecture (e.g. Clean Code, MVP, MVVM), software design patterns and TDD
Extensive experience in automotive application design, architecture, development and delivery
Significant experience in all aspects of the software development life cycle/continuous integration, process, tools and good command of Agile Methodologies and Rituals
Hands on development experience with C++, Java, Kotlin, Android, embedded Linux/QNX.

Education and Training

Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Software Engineering.

Advanced degree in engineering, business or management/leadership preferred.

Innovation lives here, so should you!

Design and develop the world's best in-vehicle applications for GM Infotainment systems
Responsible for the entire software development process of your domain, including requirements, system design, development, deployment, and maintenance of the Infotainment software

Experience with Agile/Scrum/SAFe development process and tools
Ability to perform diagnostic and investigate issues based on limited information
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Creative, disciplined, strong sense of responsibility, delivery and schedule commitment

Software development experience in a variety of embedded system
Experience with scripting, tool development and test automation framework

Advanced degrees preferred

Rove Concepts, a contemporary home décor brand and eCommerce furniture retailer, is looking for a General Support - Customer Service Agent to join our growing team.
Our objective is to maximize sales opportunities through both showroom and eCommerce channels. At the same time, we answer customer requests in a prompt and respectable manner while maintaining a high level of service at every touch-point.


Kindly note that our operations are 7 days a week, including public holidays and weekends, all candidates are considered on open availability.


What you will be doing:
As a Customer Service Agent, you will be part of the team that takes care of our customers. In this critical front-line role, you will be tasked with providing general support for customers involving things like store policy, shipping lead times, general product knowledge, brand information etc. through multiple channels including inbound and outbound phone calls, emails and live chats.

Attending to inbound and outbound calls, live chats, emails,
Providing excellent customer service clearly answering customers’ questions and providing accurate information and suitable solutions.
Collaborating with the client care team members as well as the sales team on individual files to find the best solutions for the customers.
Demonstrating conflict resolution and interpersonal skills in order to help deescalate customer issues while being empathetic in tone
Maximizing sales during key periods (aka. Black Friday)
Dedicating your time to customer success; you will aim to always go above and beyond, and you won’t stop until you’ve found a great solution for our customers.
Ensuring customers have a quick response time by staying on top of your assigned tickets, with same-day ticket review.


What you need to succeed:
The Customer Service Agent position is a customer-facing job that involves aspects of both traditional customer service roles and customer education and retention type roles. Candidates applying for this position should be comfortable dealing with situations in which customers can be upset or passionate from time to time.

Extensive experience providing exceptional customer service in a contact center, retail or service environment.

Department Information

The Tlicho Community Services Agency is a unique organization responsible for the delivery of education, health and social services within the Tlicho region. The Tlicho Community Services Agency's vision 'Strong Like Two People' is a metaphor for the desire by community leadership to build an organization, and create programs and services that recognize the strength and importance of two cultures.


Job Information

The scope of the Tlicho Community Services Agency is to manage the delivery of a range of integrated public GNWT and First Nations health, wellness and education programs and services for the Tlicho communities of Behchoko, Gameti, Wekweeti and Whati. Established in 2005 as part of the Tlicho Agreement, the Agency is designed to be an interim GNWT organization through which the Tlicho Government will eventually exercise their treaty rights for self-government The Agency serves approximately 3,000 people, employs 230 staff and has an annual budget approximately of 30 million dollars. Programs and services include K-12 education, health and wellness, child and family services, mental health and addictions, continuing care and independent living.

Job Description:

Customer Service Representative – Domremy, SK, CA
At Nutrien, our Purpose is to grow our world from the ground up and we do so with safety and integrity as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
Nutrien Ag Solutions is the retail division of Nutrien™, the largest crop inputs company in the world. As part of our collective mission of Feeding the Future, Nutrien Ag Solutions provides full-acre solutions through our trusted crop consultants at more than 2,000 locations in North America, South America, Europe and Australia. For more than 150 years, we have been helping growers achieve the highest yields with a wide selection of products, including our proprietary brands: Loveland Products, Inc.; Proven®Seed and Dyna-Gro®Seed; as well as financial, custom application and precision ag services.
We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion.
Working at Nutrien Ag Solutions will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career.
What you will do:
Receive customers, answer their questions regarding product availability and commodity/service prices, completes order forms for order given and received payments for sales made
Work with operations staff and customers via telephone, in person, or by email, to complete the product bookings and/or product orders and forward to operations staff for shipment when required
Under the direction of the Branch Manager and/or Assistant Manager, monitors accounts receivable, accounts payable and credit limits
Receive and post payments to customer accounts – while ensuring 100% accuracy
Print Daily Reports as required under Policy and Procedures including the “End of Day Report”, and “Payments Listing”
Reconcile cheque and credit card payments daily
Maintain confidential office records and files covering daily transactions made at the facility that includes customer invoices, stock transfers and shipment notices
Assist with National Safety Code file submission and maintenance and corporate Environment Health and Safety Program, as required
Track staff training, submitting required paperwork to Asmark and completing Monthly Meeting Minutes and/or Site Inspections
Assist with new hire and re-hire paperwork and maintain confidential employee files for each employee as required by the Human Resources Department
Complete administrative correspondence as required; including but not limited to letters, memo’s and emails
Plan and set up branch displays as required
Compile and provide information on items such as stocks in store, product sales, prices, shipments and accounts outstanding as requested by the Branch Manager and/or Assistant Manager
Assist with inventory control by tracking inventory coming in and going out of the location. Prepare stock transfers and product orders as required
Assist with inventory spot checks and monthly/yearly inventory cut-offs
Maintain and order office supplies
Open and distribute incoming mail and packages, and direct outgoing mail on a daily basis
Assist location in the receipt of shipments of supplies and/or inventory
Check shipments for damaged articles, quality and quantity of merchandise received, and places goods in designated storage areas as required
Restock shelves from stock room supplies and, upon approval of the Branch Manager and/or Assistant Manager, orders stock which has reached a low level
Perform necessary housekeeping duties
Perform the responsibilities of other market area positions during staff absences in order to optimize the efficiency of market area operations
Perform other related duties as required
What you will bring:
High school diploma or equivalent required
1+ years previous customer service experience
Knowledge of farm supply products and services a definite asset
Computer and keyboarding skills; Demonstrated ability in the use of word processing, database and spreadsheet software
Excellent interpersonal skills with a positive attitude and ability to establish relationship with branch personnel, peers and customers
Demonstrated ability to produce neat and accurate work with attention to detail
Must be dependable, reliable, and safety conscious
Effective time management, planning and multi-tasking skills
Are you a good match? Apply today!

We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics

Position Description:

Serco Canada Inc. operates all the DriveTest Centres across Ontario on behalf of the Ministry of Transportation. As a customer service agent with Serco Canada Inc., you will be based out of one of our 56 Ontario DriveTest Centres. If you are a positive and professional team player who enjoys working with the public in a high energy environment, rewarding job opportunities await you at Serco Canada Inc.
Customer service agents are responsible for providing information and assisting members of the public at various stages of the driver’s licensing process. Some of the work includes responding to customer inquiries in person and on the telephone, providing information about licence rules and regulations, verifying driver records, taking applicant photos, scheduling road test appointments, collecting applicable fees, and preparing reports. Customer service agents must have excellent time management and organizational skills and exercise superior judgment skills. We require individuals who can work independently, meet deadlines, and strive to achieve customer satisfaction in all aspects of their work.
Purpose of the Job:
Provides information and assistance related to driver examination services.
Reviews information, determines test(s) requirements, and conducts/processes transactions and exams inside the DriveTest Centre.Assists in the smooth and efficient administration of examinations, including preparation of test takers entry, invigilating, the distribution of exam materials, and the collection of examinations.Ensures the fair and proper conduct of examinations.Creates a calm, professional, and supportive environment that enables applicants to perform to the best of their abilities.Provides Security Guard Testing (SGT) examination services support.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
Responds to inquiries related to driver licensing, determines applicant status, and provides information regarding test/re-test procedures and regulations relating to all classes of licences.Distributes and verifies application forms for accuracy and completeness.Investigates problems or errors in licence records and initiates corrections.Captures applicant photos, administers vision tests to ensure minimum requirements are met, and provides referrals to vision specialists.Collects applicable fees accurately.Conducts and processes knowledge tests, dispatches road test appointments, provides results, issues temporary driver’s licences, and processes licensing changes.Identifies licence exchange privileges and/or test requirements for driver’s licence applicants from other countries, provinces, and jurisdictions; assesses foreign licence eligibility, translations, and letters of authentication from other countries.Contacts members of the public to communicate information and correct errors.Administers commercial licence renewals, including accepting medical examination reports and criminal record checks.Escalates customer concerns and redirects customers to other government agencies, when required.
Qualifications:

To be successful in this role, you must have:
Valid Ontario class “G” of licence is required.
Must have at least four (4) years driving experience, verified based on “date first licenced” indicated on the Ontario driver’s licence.
1-4 years of customer service experience in a service environment is preferred to include, but not limited to:
Airline Industry
Financial Industry
Banking Industry
Federal and Local Government Services
healthcare Industry
Must have and maintain an acceptable driving record.
Intermediate-level computer skills in Microsoft Office are required.
Touch-typing and data entry.
Must be able to perform physical duties of the position, this may include sitting or standing for extended periods of time and entering and existing vehicles up to 30 times per shift.
Must pass Criminal Record Check (CPIC); Fingerprint Criminal Record Check
In addition:
**Employee hours vary based on customer demand and location’s operating hours.
**This position may require extended shift hours and possibly Saturday hours (depending on location) during certain periods of the year when Drive Test Centre volume is higher.
**This position requires the attendance of a formal training session, which includes classroom instruction with experienced and qualified trainers and on-the-job shadowing at a Drive Test Centre facilitated by a coach. If you are unsuccessful at any stage of the training, your employment will end effective immediately.

Your Opportunity:
This Administrative Support III position is responsible for daily reception for addiction and mental health programs situated at the 108 St building. This position involves working closely with and providing administrative support to the interdisciplinary team (Mental Health Therapists, Addiction Counselors, Clinic Nurses, Psychiatrists, and support staff) and is the initial point of contact for clients. The Admin III is responsible for processing high volumes of public and staff inquiries, both in-person and via telephone, and plays a key role on the team in terms of client and family engagement. They require knowledge, skill, and judgment in providing administrative services to clients and family members impacted by an addiction or mental health concern. The position requires strict adherence and sensitivity to confidentiality. The working environment is busy with many overlapping needs and demands throughout the day requiring flexibility, creativity, collaboration and the ability to multi-task effectively. Developing and supporting administrative relationships with AHS staff, partners and other multi-agency professionals is essential. Other duties as assigned may include payroll, data collection, scheduling appointments, and other related tasks. This role involves extended periods of sitting with repetitive hand movements, keyboarding, and telephone handling, with the ability to work in a busy, noisy work environment.
Description:
As an Administrative Support III, you will require advanced administrative or specialized skills and knowledge to support complex procedures, practices and initiatives within a department or program.
Classification: Administrative Support III
Union: AUPE GSS
Department: AMH Administrative Support
Primary Location: Edmonton Mental Health Clinic
Multi-Site: Not Applicable

Date Available: 04-JAN-2022
Hours per Shift: Varies
Length of Shift in weeks: Varies
Shifts per cycle: Varies

Days Off: Other

Maximum Salary: $27.69
Vehicle Requirement: Not Applicable
Required Qualifications:
Completion of Grade 12 or equivalent.
Additional Required Qualifications:
Excellent computer proficiency with Electronic Medical Records (Connect Care), and experience with Microsoft Word and Excel. Attention to detail and professional, courteous, prompt customer service. Must have excellent interpersonal and conflict resolution skills. Must have the ability to organize and prioritize. Must be flexible and able to meet the demands of changes in work assignments. Must have proficient use of the English language oral and written. Ability to multitask and manage a high volume of confidential clinical information is required. Must have working knowledge of privacy legislation (HIA and FOIP) and the Mental Health Act. Candidate must be able to tolerate regular twisting and reaching, repetitive hand movements, keyboarding and telephone handling. Must be able to lift up to 20lbs when required.
Preferred Qualifications:
Two years recent related secretarial experience, including customer service and conflict resolution experience would be an asset. Previous experience working in the area of addiction and mental health is preferred. Completion of post-secondary education (e.g. course(s) in business administration, medical office assistant), or other related fields would be an asset. Experience operating multi-line switchboard would be an asset.

The Director, FinTech Partnerships is responsible for identifying and acquiring new capabilities, driving innovation, creating new business models, and accelerating the Bank’s digital transformation through partnerships with Fintechs. Business Engagement:

o the design and execution of proofs-of-concepts
o co-development and incubation of products and new business models
Stay at the forefront of market developments related to emerging technologies and business models and understand the implications, opportunities and threats for Business LinesAct as a conduit and anchor between the ecosystem and internal partners by making strategic connections, fostering communication, and knowledge exchange
Ecosystem:

Process:
You will support the creation of frameworks within which the Bank will execute proofs-of-concept to validate ideas and business modelsYou will create project management processes, manage select projects, and produce overall reports for the team
Team:
You will lead a team of product managers and cross-functional teamsYou will support the preparation of presentations and material to communicate the Bank’s innovation strategy to internal and external stakeholders, ensuring continuous alignment to the business strategyYou will collaborate with branding and communications teams to spread awareness of key activitiesYou will motivate, develop, and inspire others; encourage team development; promote positive inter-team interactions and bring a high-level of enthusiasm

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?
You have an intrinsic curiosity about FinTech (banking, insurance, wealth management, etc), and pursue new ideas and understand how they can be applied in financial servicesYou have 5-7 years of experience in the financial services industry – with a Bank or Fintech - and expert knowledge of financial productsYou are a strong leader with experience leading digital product managers and collaborating with Senior LeadersYou have a proven track record of delivering digital product and solutions from concept to launch, and managing associated change managementYou have experience developing and launching mutually beneficial products or solutions with partnershipsYou thrive in cross-functional and distributed teams, and have amazing interpersonal and leadership skillsYou have great relationship management and influencing skills to ensure continuous business support from key stakeholdersYou have the ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging, and dynamic environmentSpanish language skills would be an asset

What's in it for you?
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!Hybrid work arrangementsYou'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the worldDress codes don't apply here, being comfortable doesThis isn't your typical "corporate" job. As the Manager, Customer Experience, you will contribute to the overall success of Global Business Payments by supporting the development, seamless delivery, and sustainment of priority initiatives that optimize the end-to-end business banking experience for Scotiabank customers.

Customer Experience Program Portfolio:
Contribute to the ongoing design, development, and execution of programs and initiatives focused on driving a customer centric experience
Support the creation and management of end-to-end project plans related to customer experience programs, including training, communications, feedback loops, technology, and partner engagement
Lead the execution and delivery of new actions/projects to optimize the customer experience, with an end-to-end view of the customer journey
Help oversee customer contact management of all Global Business Payments Products & Services customer research initiatives
Collaborate on Customer Journey Mapping sessions for key product and process journeys
Maintain updates to sites and resources owned/managed by the Customer Experience team, making strategic recommendations to further evolve content
Customer Experience Analytics:
Manage the ongoing definition, sourcing and tracking of key data sources designed to provide insight into Customer Experience quality across Global Business Payments
Support data collection and review, collaborate on content preparation for presentation materials, manage logistics and coordinate sharing of meaningful insights/opportunities back to stakeholders through various mediums
Assist with root cause analysis and produces meaningful customer insights from feedback received through multiple data sources, to identify, track and make specific “Voice of the Customer” recommendations to the Senior Manager
Triage, distribute and track Customer Experience issues raised by the field and partners, to generate insights and recommendations to the appropriate Product Owners
Refine dashboard reporting to ensure data is accurate and meaningful
Relationship Management:
Support the Senior Manager, Customer Experience with segment and partner contact activities for Customer Experience programs
Establish strong relationships with Global Business Payments agile labs, in order to gain (and maintain) a solid understanding of lab activities and inform continuous improvement for the Customer Experience program portfolio
Understanding how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Pursuing effective and efficient operations of your respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles

Championing a high performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.

3+ years relevant experience, preferably in banking, financial services or customer experience
Customer advocacy and a client-first mindset
A proven track record managing multiple cross-functional business, partner, and customer relationships
Strong planning, problem solving and data analytics skills to support decision making
Excellent organization skills and can work well under pressure to complete and/or manage multiple projects/initiatives in an efficient and timely manner
Flexibility to adapt quickly and deliver results in a challenging and changing environment
Excellent communication skills (written, verbal and listening)
Strong project management skills, capable of developing and executing plans
Advanced proficiency with MS Office (in particular PowerPoint, Excel and Visio)
Experience with SQL, Power BI and Google Analytics is an asset

You'll get to work with multiple stakeholders worldwide in the bank
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences
Access to thousands of online and in-person courses so you can brush up on skills, or learn new ones
Career progression opportunities. We hire you for your talent and not just for the job. We want to see you succeed not just in your role but in your career as a whole

Brandt is currently seeking a Regional Customer Support Sales Manager for our Saskatchewan & Manitoba region.

As key player in the growth and development of the product support program, the Regional Customer Support Sales Manager will participate and engage with the Sales, Parts, Service and Branch manager to execute and develop key objectives for the region. This position will ensure our CSA’s are held accountable for product support sales growth and customer engagement.


Duties & Responsibilities

Own Strategy and Annual Business plans for Region with objectives to achieve sales and margin growth.
Educate and direct the CSA’s to ensure all of Brandt’s product support initiatives are promoted within the region (examples)
Manage CSA Processes such as Call reporting, CRM, and target setting
Assist CSAs with customer calls and key accounts
Establish key KPI’s for CSA’s and measure on a monthly basis
Analyze and implement proper coverage for the region
Engage directly with the larger accounts in the region to promote Brandt’s full product support offering
Provide feedback on regional industry trends.
Growth opportunities
Initiate new offerings
Promote existing offerings
Market Intelligence on competition, customers, and segment trends
Analyze sales and margin data to identify opportunities
Analyze Reports to provide insight and feedback to guide performance of CSA’s and branches
Identify new product opportunities and work internally to supply

Required Skills

Sales management and the ability to drive the sales process from inception to close
Strong industry expertise and knowledge in the heavy equipment business, specifically in the areas or repair and maintenance
Ability to build strong customer relationships, maintain relationships with key customers at all levels including executive-level managers
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
Ability to recruit, train, and motivate a team to pursue and grow the business
Highly organized with the ability to work well under time pressure and handle multiple projects simultaneously

Strong collaboration and relationship building skills to drive results through motivating and influencing

Required Experience
As a leader of our team of CSA professionals, the successful candidate must have a proven track record in sales management, be dedicated to outstanding customer service, be well organized, and have the ability to work both independently and as part of a highly motivated team. The ideal candidate will have a relevant combination of education and experience along with a proven track record in the heavy equipment product support business.

The Global Technology Solutions (GTS) - Support Services’ Global Disaster Recovery team is mandated to ensure that all Critical, High and Critical Information Assets (CIA) Applications and Services are proven to be capable of operating from their alternate datacenter(s) by conducting annual testing. Disaster recovery events when effectively executed contribute to the prevention of incidents and service delivery stability. The role:
You are a part of a team that ensures the Disaster Recovery policies, processes and automation tool adherence for all Scotiabank applications and services. You will alignment with the organizational Enterprise Delivery Framework specifically pertaining to Disaster Recovery; focusing on the Public Cloud space. You will interlock closely with project/application/service stakeholders to provide effective governance in a fast-paced environment. You will be required to proactive through leadership diligence to prioritize and complete tasks effectively and independently.
Is this role right for you?

Company

Swyft is a software-enabled B2B marketplace that enables any sized merchant, brand or retailer with same and next-day delivery at rates comparable to 2+ day delivery. Our mission is to create magical delivery experiences for shoppers & help merchants grow sales with the most scalable and flexible same/next-day delivery service.

We aren't just a shipping and logistics company, we are building the data and framework layer for how a trillion parcels will move within hundreds of cities. Swyft is air traffic control for parcels routed from your favourite store to your door, and you can help us realize this vision. Founded in April 2020, we are fueled by creating delightful customer and employee experience through an experimental and data driven approach. We've recently raised over $20M and are backed by the world's best investors including Inovia Capital, Forerunner Ventures, Golden Ventures, Trucks VC, and Shopify.

The Merchant Success Representative will own the merchant operational relationship and will be responsible for the success of our business relationship with each one of our merchant partners. You will work in conjunction with the commercial team and the product team to ensure a successful customer experience to all our merchants. You will provide a supporting role for the Engineering team in addressing merchant related technical issues and providing feedback on the merchants products' improvement requirements.


Your Responsibilities

Execute on our Merchant Success model inclusive of onboarding, daily account management, success planning, and service consumption
Be responsible for the comprehension and delivery of customers' last-mile logistics goals as they relate to Swyft's service, and ensuring that the goal and success criteria are aligned to the services we provide
Manage all aspects of the Merchant onboarding process including the initial touchpoint, technical integration, and launch
Act as a liaison to Swyft's Customer Support Team on behalf of your customers
Assist customers with any escalated issues and questions pertaining to their Shopper's deliveries, tracking, the Swyft platform/marketplace, and any other topics on their business with Swyft
Have a thorough understanding of our success and performance metrics and what levers to pull to influence them
Expand revenue in existing accounts by working with the Business Operations/Analyst team to identify upsell opportunities through helping our Merchants increase conversions through the proper positioning of the Same Day delivery offering
Provide ongoing training to clients on the functionality of the Merchant's Swyft portal, ensuring they are utilizing it to its fullest potential


About you

Ability to multitask and meet timelines.
Establish and maintain solid communication with other departments.
Full understanding of the systems' functionalities & company operations.
People oriented fast thinker with a flexible positive attitude.
Commercial oriented, able to identify opportunities for upgrade in merchant contracts
Service oriented, build successful relationships with merchants to meet company's retention targets
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with priority management based on severity of issue, customer sensitivity, customer and revenue impact

Requisition ID: 79114
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Purpose of Job:
As a Home Financing Advisor (HFA) you will be responsible for maximizing the development of residential mortgage business from third party referral sources such as real estate agents, lawyers, financial planners, and centres of influence with the goal of bringing new customers to the Bank.
Is this role right for you?
You’re entrepreneurial, driven, and you love that every day is different. You’re willing to work variable hours including weekends and evenings and you’re available to meet clients at times that are convenient for them
Whether it’s conducting mortgage seminars or building a marketing program, you enjoy business development and getting out in the community
This role is 100% commission, which puts your future in your own hands
Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:
You have strong sales management experience and have the ability to market yourself, the mortgage business, and Scotiabank effectively

Unique lead generation programs, marketing and social selling programs, Salesforce CRM and COI loyalty program paid for and supported by the Bank.
